answers.What is PM-KISAN scheme?: PM-KISAN is a Central Sector Scheme that provides income support of ₹6,000 per year to all landholding farmer families across the country in three equal installments of ₹2,000 each every four months.
answers.What are the benefits?:
• Direct cash transfer of ₹6,000 per year
• No intermediaries involved
• Money directly credited to bank account
• Helps in meeting agricultural expenses
• Covers all landholding farmers
answers.Required documents:
• Aadhaar Card
• Bank Account Details
• Land Records (Khata/Khatauni)
• Mobile Number
• Passport Size Photo
answers.How to apply?:
1. Visit PM-KISAN portal (pmkisan.gov.in)
2. Click on 'New Farmer Registration'
3. Enter Aadhaar number and mobile
4. Fill required details
5. Upload documents
6. Submit application
answers.Eligibility criteria:
• Must be a landholding farmer
• Should have cultivable land
• Aadhaar card is mandatory
• Valid bank account required
• Excludes institutional landholders

answers.What is crop insurance?: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) provides insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in case of crop failure due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases.
answers.Coverage and benefits:
• Covers all food crops, oilseeds, and annual commercial/horticultural crops
• Protection against natural disasters
• Coverage for post-harvest losses
• Technology-based claim settlement
• Affordable premium rates
answers.Premium rates:
• Kharif crops: 2% of sum insured
• Rabi crops: 1.5% of sum insured
• Annual commercial/horticultural crops: 5% of sum insured
• Government provides subsidy on premium
answers.How to enroll?:
1. Visit nearest bank or insurance company
2. Fill application form
3. Provide land records and Aadhaar
4. Pay premium amount
5. Get insurance certificate
answers.Claim process:
1. Report crop loss within 72 hours
2. Insurance company conducts survey
3. Assessment of crop damage
4. Claim settlement within 60 days
5. Amount credited to bank account

answers.What is Soil Health Card?: Soil Health Card Scheme provides soil health cards to farmers which carry crop-wise recommendations of nutrients and fertilizers required for individual farms to help farmers improve productivity through judicious use of inputs.
answers.Benefits of soil testing:
• Know exact nutrient status of soil
• Reduce fertilizer costs
• Improve crop productivity
• Prevent soil degradation
• Optimize fertilizer use
• Increase farm income
answers.How to get soil tested?:
1. Contact local agriculture office
2. Collect soil samples as per guidelines
3. Submit samples at testing center
4. Pay nominal fee if applicable
5. Receive soil health card within 30 days
answers.Reading the report:
• pH level indicates soil acidity/alkalinity
• NPK shows nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium levels
• Organic carbon content
• Micronutrient status
• Recommendations for each crop
answers.Recommended actions:
• Follow fertilizer recommendations
• Use organic manures as suggested
• Apply lime if soil is acidic
• Add micronutrients if deficient
• Adopt soil conservation practices

answers.Loan benefits:
• Flexible credit limit
• Lower interest rates
• No collateral for loans up to ₹1.6 lakh
• Crop insurance coverage
• ATM-cum-debit card facility
• Revolving credit facility
answers.Eligibility requirements:
• Individual/joint farmers
• Tenant farmers and sharecroppers
• Self Help Group members
• Valid land records
• Good credit history
• Age: 18-75 years
answers.Application process:
1. Visit nearest bank branch
2. Fill KCC application form
3. Submit required documents
4. Bank verification process
5. Credit limit sanctioned
6. Receive KCC and debit card
answers.Interest rates:
• Interest rate: 7% per annum
• 3% interest subvention by government
• Effective rate: 4% for prompt repayers
• Additional 3% incentive for timely repayment
• Final rate can be as low as 1%
answers.Repayment terms:
• Flexible repayment schedule
• Can repay after harvest
• Revolving credit facility
• No penalty for early repayment
• Grace period available
